metadata.title: CVE-2019-16779 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In RubyGem excon before 0.71.0, there was a race condition aroundpersistent connections, where a connection which is interrupted (such as bya timeout) would leave data on the socket. Subsequent requests would thenread this data, returning content from the previous response. The racecondition window appears to be short, and it would be difficult topurposefully exploit this.

criterions.comment: ruby-excon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
